author: Simon Rice
title: Roberto Martinez explains the improvement Chelsea will see in Romelu Lukaku if he returns
text:
Romelu Lukaku is the current Premier League top scorer with 21 goals (Getty) If Chelsea re-sign Romelu Lukaku this summer it’ll be an admission they made a mistake letting him go; however, the striker won’t be quite the same player they allowed to leave, according to Roberto Martinez.
After sending the Belgium international out on loan to West Brom and Everton – during which he scored lots of goals (17 at the Hawthorns and 15 at Goodison Park) – his sale to the Toffees was sanctioned. He’s continued to excel and currently finds himself leading the Premier League top scorer charts.
Man Utd 'on verge' of sealing £86m signing to delight Mourinho There’s now much talk Chelsea want him back, particularly if Diego Costa departs Stamford Bridge .
Martinez, who managed Lukaku at Everton and is now his national team manager with Belgium, has explained the areas in which Lukaku has improved since Chelsea sold him three years ago.
‘He always wants to do more in training. At a very young age he had an incredible goal scoring threat,’ Martinez explained to the BBC .
‘Any footballer who is special at the highest level you have to be outstanding at something; Rom it’s the goal scoring threat that he carries.
‘From the age of 21 to the age of 23 now he’s changed a lot. He wants to improve, he works on his hold up play, he works on using his body, he’s been working on his movement in the box. But what he’s never ever lost is the outstanding quality of scoring goals.’

Chelsea allowed Lukaku to leave for £28million but may have to spend as much as £70m to bring him back. But according to Martinez he could be worth every penny.
‘If you look at the facts there at the age of 23 I think he’s got the possibility of becoming the best No 9 in world football. He’s got absolutely everything.’
